text: Krzysztof Płatek (born 13 January 1962 in Strzelin) is a Polish former athlete who specialised in the sprint hurdles. He represented his country at the 1987 World Championships reaching the semifinals. He is also a two-time outdoor and one-time indoor national champion. His personal bests are 13.61 seconds in the 110 metres hurdles (+1.7 m/s; Warsaw 1988) and 7.78 seconds in the 60 metres hurdles (Zabrze 1987).All-Athletics profile ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |1985 |European Indoor Championships |Piraeus, Greece |18th (h) |60 m hurdles |7.97 |- |1986 |European Indoor Championships |Madrid, Spain |9th (h) |60 m hurdles |7.87 |- |rowspan=2|1987 |European Indoor Championships |Liévin, France |10th (h) |60 m hurdles |7.84 |- |World Championships |Rome, Italy |11th (sf) |110 m hurdles |13.68 |} ==References== Category:1962 births Category:Living people Category:Polish male hurdlers Category:World Athletics Championships athletes for Poland Category:People from Strzelin
title: Krzysztof Płatek
